newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real rises 0.03 pct on dollar inflows.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real rises 0.03 pct on dollar inflows.

text.p: Brazil's real rose 0.03 percent to close at 1.0646 per dollar on dollar inflows in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
Preliminary figures for commercial and financial forex contracts showed a $130 million surplus on Thursday.
Market sources said there may be a new decline in the reais-dollar mini-band on Friday.
The current mini-band was set on Tuesday by the Central Bank at between 1.0645 and 1.0695 reais per dollar, down 0.09 percent from the previous one.
In the interbank floating rate market, the real closed at 1.0696 per dollar, down 0.01 percent.
In the parallel market, the real rose 0.61 percent to end at 1.133 per dollar, traders said.
